text:
What is this method?

Drive out the the domains, bounded contexts & services of a system to reveal vertical slices, trouble spots & starting points for rearchitecting it.
plainText: What is this method? Drive out the the domains, bounded contexts & services of a system to reveal vertical slices, trouble spots & starting points for rearchitecting it.

text: Event Storming enables decomposing monoliths into microservices. It allows for modeling new flows and ideas, synthesizing knowledge, and facilitating active group participation without conflict in order to ideate the next generation of a software system.
plainText: Event Storming enables decomposing monoliths into microservices. It allows for modeling new flows and ideas, synthesizing knowledge, and facilitating active group participation without conflict in order to  ideate the next generation of a software system.

text:
When you need to:

  • clarify a current state via cross-functional communication
  • break down monolithic systems
  • identify the top constraint in a system
  • identify subdomains and bounded contexts of a system
plainText: When you need to: clarify a current state via cross-functional communicationbreak down monolithic systemsidentify the top constraint in a systemidentify subdomains and bounded contexts of a system

text:
You know you‚Äôve finished when you have:

  • Shared understanding of the system / business process
  • Ubiquitous Language for clear communication across groups
  • A list of Service Candidates to begin rearchitecting the system
  • A list of user journeys or system functionality, also known as "thin slices" that can be used when exercising the system model (see Boris)
  • Top pains/constraints in the system
  • A system/vision oriented thought process
plainText: You know you‚Äôve finished when you have: Shared understanding of the system / business processUbiquitous Language for clear communication across groupsA list of Service Candidates to begin rearchitecting the systemA list of user journeys or system functionality, also known as "thin slices" that can be used when exercising the system model (see Boris)Top pains/constraints in the systemA system/vision oriented thought process

text:
Business stakeholders, Business Analysts, Executives, Developers, Architects, Team Leads, Domain Experts,

Core Team members.
plainText: Business stakeholders, Business Analysts, Executives, Developers, Architects, Team Leads, Domain Experts, Core Team members.

text: Take some time at the beginning of the workshop to outline expected outcomes with a dashed box.
plainText: Take some time at the beginning of the workshop to outline expected outcomes with a dashed box.

text:
Sometimes referred to as "domain event", a Business Event is something that happens in the business process.


Examples: "application completed", "validation failed", "food consumed"


Add a yellow post it for every business event that you can think of.


  • Don't worry about duplicates, we'll go through that later.

  • Write each event in the past tense, one per post it.
plainText: Sometimes referred to as "domain event", a Business Event is something that happens in the business process.   Examples: "application completed", "validation failed", "food consumed"   Add a yellow post it for every business event that you can think of.   Don't worry about duplicates, we'll go through that later. Write each event in the past tense, one per post it.
Icebreaker (5 mins)Introduction team (5 mins)Introduction practice (5 min)...

text:
Please remain on mute when not speaking


Please turn video on


Please announce if you are leaving/arriving during the sessions


Use Zoom‚Äôs chat feature to request to speak or ask a question if needed


Please refrain from side conversations as they distract people
plainText: Please remain on mute when not speaking   Please turn video on   Please announce if you are leaving/arriving during the sessions   Use Zoom‚Äôs chat feature to request to speak or ask a question if needed   Please refrain from side conversations as they distract people

text:
We set clear goals and will stick to today‚Äôs timed agenda


We will improvise the agenda if necessary


We stay focused and put digressions in the ‚ÄúParking Lot‚Äù for conversations getting in-the-weeds


We encourage balanced speaking time to increase alignment and understanding
plainText: We set clear goals and will stick to today‚Äôs timed agenda   We will improvise the agenda if necessary   We stay focused and put digressions in the ‚ÄúParking Lot‚Äù for conversations getting in-the-weeds   We encourage balanced speaking time to increase alignment and understanding

text: Fill out the Agenda and tik about whether you would like to add an a remote team activity (e.g., icebreaker) to start with! Please have a look for Tanzu - Icebreaker Templates in Miro or on the Tanzu practices site.
plainText: Fill out the Agenda and tik about whether you would like to add an a remote team activity (e.g., icebreaker) to start with! Please have a look for Tanzu - Icebreaker Templates in Miro or on the Tanzu practices site.

text:
Pick post-its one-by-one and order them on the board:


  • Identify the beginning and end of the event storming session,

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉfor example:


  • START: customer went to website
  • END: customer received food delivery


  • Place the business events on the boards in time order

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉfrom left to right, and deduplicate them


  • Represent parallel processing using vertical space


  • When there is confusion or conflicts around language, agree on common language and add a sticky to the "Definition"


  • Tag post-its with "unclear" in red when there are questions

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉor a need for clarification
plainText: Pick post-its one-by-one and order them on the board:   Identify the beginning and end of the event storming session,‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉfor example:   START: customer went to websiteEND: customer received food delivery  Place the business events on the boards in time order‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉfrom left to right, and deduplicate them   Represent parallel processing using vertical space  When there is confusion or conflicts around language, agree on common language and add a sticky to the "Definition"  Tag post-its with "unclear" in red when there are questions‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉor a need for clarification

text:
The Event Storming facilitator's main responsibility is to create safe environment for the exchange and output of ideas and data. For groups of 15-20, usually count 2 to 3 facilitators.


Start simple and then add the information in layers, incrementally.


Event Storming is usually conducted in two phases. A high level Event Storm to identify the domains and then a subsequent Event Storm into a top constraint - the core domain.
plainText: The Event Storming facilitator's main responsibility is to create safe environment for the exchange and output of ideas and data. For groups of 15-20, usually count 2 to 3 facilitators.   Start simple and then add the information in layers, incrementally.   Event Storming is usually conducted in two phases. A high level Event Storm to identify the domains and then a  subsequent Event Storm into a top constraint - the core domain.

text:
Ensure that there is equal representation of different disciplines present.


Try to time box explanations in order to keep things succinct.


Create a space in which people feel comfortable being honest by setting up the right context for the session.


Curtail finger-pointing or unkind feedback.


Ensure that the actions are actionable and not too general (e.g., "Don't do this ...").
plainText: Ensure that there is equal representation of different disciplines present.   Try to time box explanations in order to keep things succinct.   Create a space in which people feel comfortable being honest by setting up the right context for the session.   Curtail finger-pointing or unkind feedback.   Ensure that the actions are actionable and not too general (e.g., "Don't do this ...").

text: If you have a large group, consider breaking into teams for generating ideas.
plainText: If you have a large group, consider breaking into teams for generating ideas.

text:
Consider having a facilitator in each breakout room to facilitate conversations in that room.


Setting up Zoom breakout rooms will require some preparation. You'll need to manually assign people to rooms, or otherwise have people auto-assigned; having a co-facilitator helps!


When time is up, everyone will be moved back into the main room. However, sometimes it is not clear when that will happen, and people might be transported back abruptly. Advise the group beforehand how much time they have, and by how long the time will be extended, if required.


A facilitator may manually visit each breakout room to move them forward and do time checks.


It's easier to keep to the same breakout groups, since the group would have built rapport during discussion. Zoom will automatically keep track of who was in which breakout room.
plainText: Consider having a facilitator in each breakout room to facilitate conversations in that room.   Setting up Zoom breakout rooms will require some preparation. You'll need to manually assign people to rooms, or otherwise have people auto-assigned; having a co-facilitator helps!   When time is up, everyone will be moved back into the main room. However, sometimes it is not clear when that will happen, and people might be transported back abruptly. Advise the group beforehand how much time they have, and by how long the time will be extended, if required.   A facilitator may manually visit each breakout room to move them forward and do time checks.   It's easier to keep to the same breakout groups, since the group would have built rapport during discussion. Zoom will automatically keep track of who was in which breakout room.

text:
Customize these boards as needed; it will not affect the master template.


Copy and paste additional frames for individuals/teams.


Be sure to include navigation waypoints to help people navigate when zooming in and out.


Lock frames and anything you don't want to get accidentally moved (i.e., everything except Sticky Notes?).


Remove all facilitator notes (this box, the Facilitator Notes & Tips box, Facilitator Tips and Tool Tips) before running the activity; all facilitator elements are grouped. Click on this box and delete.


Copy and paste Sticky Notes to sort them in the 2x2s instead of dragging them over; this ensures you don't lose anything.


Practice ahead of time.


Make use of the "Bring everyone to me" feature if people are struggling to navigate the Miro board. Click your initials in the top right corner.


Have a a facilitator-only messaging channel for back-channel communication.


Open the Frames menu to easily navigate between sections while facilitating, which helps avoid too much movement on screen when moving between sections.

Remove all facilitator notes (this box, the Facilitator Notes & Tips box, Facilitator Tips and Tool Tips) before running the activity; all facilitator elements are grouped. text:
Webex has break-out rooms.


Consider setting up multiple simultaneous conferences that people can join as needed. This is likely to incur delays, so plan some buffer time for people to switch between meetings.
plainText: Webex has break-out rooms.   Consider setting up multiple simultaneous conferences that people can join as needed. This is likely to incur delays, so plan some buffer time for people to switch between meetings.
